page.title: 04Housing in N.W.Guildford
page.content: Some of the houses in the extreme S.E. of the area are over 100 years old. Most are much newer and houses are still being built throughout the area. Both the council and private firms are developing waste and fringe farming land. The Council has an extensive modernization scheme under way in their oldest estate at Shepherds Hill, built in 1919. This work includes providing indoor toilets. Almost 8% of the housing in the area is state owned. There are no plans for further large developments in the area as building land is scarce, though the vacated land at{Stoughton Barracks would be an ideal site. Housing throughout the area, both private and state is mixed, each estate usually having bungalows, semi-detached and detached houses, and flats.
